sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Str.Lower function takes the string s and returns a string in which all the upper case letters are converted to lower case. For example, Str.Lower ("ABC123def") returns "abc123def".
sections.text_content:
The Str.Lower function takes the string s and returns
          a string in which all the upper case letters are converted to 
          lower case. For example, Str.Lower ("ABC123def") returns
          "abc123def".
sections.mdown_content: The **Str.Lower** function takes the string _s_ and returnsa string in which all the upper case letters are converted to lower case. For example, `Str.Lower ("ABC123def")` returns`"abc123def"`.

sections.title: Example
code:
var line : string
        loop
            put "Enter a line of text (empty to quit): " ..
            get line : *
            exit when line = ""
            put "The lower case version: ", Str.Lower (line)
        end loop
sections.raw_content: This program obtains lines of text from the user and outputs the lines converted to lower case.
sections.text_content:
This program obtains lines of text from the user and outputs the
          lines converted to lower case.
sections.mdown_content: This program obtains lines of text from the user and outputs thelines converted to lower case.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Str.Lower, not by calling Lower.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
          This means that you can only call the function by calling 
          Str.Lower, not by calling Lower.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling **Str.Lower**, not by calling **Lower**.
